headline: Contract Specialist at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary:
â¢Experienced working with federal clients on site
â¢Fast learner, detail oriented, and self-motivated
â¢Strong written and oral communication skills
â¢Comfortable and effective working with clients on several projects at once
â¢Team oriented leader who motivates others to exceed expectations
â¢Excellent at presenting and communicating complex ideas clearly
â¢Able to develop strong working relationships with colleagues and clients

positions.description:
Department of Homeland Security, Immigration and Customs Enforcement, Office of Acquisition Management
â¢Conduct interviews with ICE employees to gain a strong understanding of current processes in designated contract sections; Detention, Compliance and Removals (DCR), Information Technologies Division (ITD), and Mission Support (MS). Summarize key findings and interview notes for client use. 
â¢Experience interpreting and applying laws, regulations, policies and procedures relevant to contracting and detention issues, including performance based national detention standards (PBNDS), Services Contract Act, Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA), etc. 
â¢Experience reviewing a variety of service contracts including IT support services, financial management services, detention management services and guard services.
â¢Strong understanding of solicitation, administration, close-out and termination of purchase orders and contracts.
â¢Review requisitions to ensure proper specification or descriptions are included and evaluate bids or proposals for compliance. 
â¢Implement new processes and procedures to improve work flow and increase efficiency. Establish and adjust administrative policies and procedures as needed.
â¢Create process maps for OAQ current processes, make recommendations for process improvement, and draft standard operating procedures.
â¢Create and implement a database to improve OAQ response time to DHS data calls and Freedom of Information Act requests (FOIA). 
â¢Develop new naming conventions for contract files and improve electronic filing system. 
â¢Attend biweekly status meetings with OAQ leadership. Report proceedings back to team and write up meeting minutes. 
â¢Organize, schedule, and lead meetings and conference calls among various OAQ departments. 
â¢Develop and disseminate meeting agendas, presentation tools, and supporting documents.
positions.title: Senior Analyst

positions.description:
Department of Defense, Office of the Inspector General, Audit Policy and Oversight
â¢Coordinates DoD directives, instructions, and other guidance related to audits and audit standards.
â¢Maintains security and accountability of classified information.
â¢Actively and positively participates with other team members, providing updates on the status of audit assignments, sharing information, and identifying requisite revisions to the program and/or annual team goals.
â¢Maintains professional manner and working relationships with team members, associates, contractor and other government personnel.
â¢Responsible for tracking the organizationâs mandatory training and updating the DAMIS database with certificates.
â¢Coordinates Audit Policy publications; editing, formatting, and organizing of information.
â¢Prepares presentation materials for the deputy Directorâs use in meetings with leadership on APO issues, findings, conclusions and recommendations.
â¢Attends weekly functional meetings for all departments in Audit Policy and Oversight. 
â¢Responsible for reconciling time by running Project Detail Reports and uploading information into ATAAPS. 
â¢Point person for the Audit Follow-Up process; responsible for tracking on-going reports. 
â¢FootPrints Database expert; a tool used for tracking all upcoming Policy and Oversight project proposals.
positions.title: Analyst

positions.description:
Department of Defense, Passport and Visa Office
â¢Subject matter expert in all aspects of the visa/passport operations; including but not limited to procedural processes, preparation of documents, and regulations.
â¢Served as a customer service agent; promptly answering phone calls, responding to emails, and assisting walk in customers at the front counter. 
â¢Received and screened all incoming visitors, passport and visa documents and other mail delivered to the DoD Passport and Visa Office. . 
â¢Maintained a computerized maintenance management system to record passport and visa applicantsâ personally identifiable information, leading to successful work assignments and accurate database information. 
â¢Provided technical guidance to staff members, Passport Agents, and DoD personnel on policies and procedures pertaining to foreign travel and country entry requirements, including Permanent Change of Station (PCS).
â¢Prepared and delivered briefings to inform employees and branch chiefs of changes in travel regulations, policies, and procedures. 
â¢Experienced in fact finding and analytical techniques. Responsible for updating visa applications, country requirements, important notices, and maintaining the website.
â¢Reviewed new or proposed guidance, policy, and regulations to determine the most effective media to use in communicating with intended audiences. 
â¢Prepared correspondence, briefing materials, press releases, and other written documents for senior management. Reviewed all written communication and case materials before being distributed to the DoD community.
â¢Designed, edited content, and took pictures for the monthly and quarterly Travel Services Division and Logistics Services Washington newsletters. 
â¢Sektor team lead; maintained computerized time and attendance reports, authorized overtime, and monitored leave balance.
positions.title: Program Analyst

â¢Familiar with all embassies across Washington, DC, as well as consulates in other jurisdictions. 
â¢Attended weekly staff meetings; responsible for taking minutes.
